If the tax is not paid within 24 hours of sending the request, I reserve the right to cancel the reservation without a refund as it will be difficult to re-book the unit on such short notice.  Unfortunately, Airbnb does not have a feature to calculate and add the tax in automatically.  The tax will be assessed on the total nightly rental cost not in

reviews.comments: The host was very friendly and responsive, the place was right on the beach in a very well kept complex.

A great value for the money. This unit was nearly perfect for us, in consideration that we were there for the atmosphere, not a fancy hotel experience. The view of course is unbeatable. If this unit were any closer to the ocean, it would have fish in it. It's in a smaller complex, with nobody above you. 

The neighborhood is okay; appeared to be safe, and there are some eating/shopping options close by, but most restaurants and shops you may want to go to are a little further afield, but not more than a 3-5 minute drive (Kaanapali itself is about 10 minutes away, which is a good thing in my opinion). The road the complex is on is fairly busy, but not too noisy (most cars are going pretty slow here), see more below.

The complex itself is pretty old but appeared to be very well-maintained. There's a small beach adjacent to the complex that's okay for recreational bathing but not a destination in itself. The overall vibe was very private and intimate; a very friendly atmosphere. The pool was a huge added bonus for us; the kids wanted to use it practically every day. Honokowai Park was on the other side of the complex; we didn't go here, but the recon I did on a walk gave me the impression that the park was okay but nothing to write home about.

The overall noise level here was very minimal; no loud guests or screaming kids. There is some road noise in the front bedroom, and although I wasn't in that bedroom, it wouldn't have bugged me, and I'm a light sleeper. 

The baths were very nice and almost resort-y; overall, they were very clean although the grout could use a good cleaning, just saying. The kitchen was more than adequate for our needs, and had quite a bit of storage space. We also used the barbecues on premise a couple of times; they're impeccably maintained.

The only thing that is a drawback to this place in my opinion is that the loft can get quite stuffy, even with the fans going full blast. We were there in August, and several nights up there were fine, some others were uncomfortable, and there was 2 nights where it was extremely hard to sleep up there.

So overall, this place is perfect if you value a tranquil atmosphere with a killer view, in a nice unit in a pleasant complex, at a fair price. If you have enough guests to where you have to utilize the loft, the weather may be a roll of the dice as to how comfortable it is.

Angelica's apartment is excellent and the view is out of the world. Centrally located to almost everything from farmers market right across the street to malls to dining options to beaches to hikes to water sports. My kids 2 and 5 had a blast watching turtles from the patio and did not want to come back. I cooked many meals and enjoyed our dinners watching the sun set. The only thing i wish is this place had an AC coz the afternoons were very warm and the apartment felt like an oven. Nights get cooler though. We will be definitely going back again. Angelica is an amazing host and she was very prompt in answering all my questions. Thank you for having us stay in your gorgeous apartment.

Angelica responded quick and was very helpful whenever I had any questions about the stay. 
The description is accurate. It was a great place to stay with useful amenities that made the stay better.  Having the beach so close made a trip to the beach hassle free. The balcony served as the perfect spot to catch the sunset. 
Location of the apt was great. It was walking distance to restaurants and stores. The drive to Lahaina and Kaanapali was easy. There is also a park around the complex that looked very nice with shaded areas. 
Overall, it was a very good stay and space for a family.

Made a last minute decision to stay here the day before we arrived which can always be risky when you don't have time to research but we had a great time. Good location to stay on the west side. Definitely a great value for the price. Hard to get a view like this without paying an arm and leg. No AC but it is pretty windy on Maui and you get good air flow through the unit. Might be too hot for some especially if they are sleeping in the loft. Local health food grocery store is across the street along with a Boss frogs to rent paddle boards, bikes and snorkeling equipment. Many of the best beaches and snorkeling as well as downtown Lahaina within 10-15 minute drive.
Great experience!  Our host was awesome and helped with all my questions. Very clean and comfortable. Only steps from the ocean! My family enjoyed eating meals out on the balcony! Highly recommend

We stayed at this condo for 5 days in early October 2016 and had a great time! So close to all the best snorkelling spots and not too far from restaurants, etc in Lahaina. Farmers market (more of an organic and gluten free market) and coffee shop are a 2 minute walk and there is a nice little beach next to the pool. From the balcony we watched sea turtles feeding on the rocks and beautiful sunsets. Loved this Air BnB!

Skøn bolig lige i vandkanten. Dejlig badestrand,  hvor også skildpadder nyder at tumle sig.
Lejligheden er ren og pæn og har stort set alt, hvad man har behov for. Der bliver lidt trangt, hvis man er mere end 4 Pers., men det gik OK for os at være 5.
Vi brugte terrassen hele tiden. Derfra er der den flotteste udsigt.
Området blev passet fint, og lækker pool hører til komplekset. Roligt kvarter med gode indkøbsmuligheder.
This is THE best place to stay. It is clean, quiet, and well-equipped. The beach is private and beautiful. I would highly reccomend it to anyone.

Angelica was an excellent host. The location and amenities were perfect and accurately described. We found it hard to leave our little oasis as everything we needed was close to home. Thanks again for sharing your home with us Angelica!
The host texted me with all the information, everything was  great.

Loved this place!  Perfect for a family of 3-4. The view does not disappoint at all and the complex is fastidiously maintained. The beach next door is perfect for little people playing in the sand and/or breakers. We saw turtles in the water everyday and one came up to rest on the beach the last day! 

The loft gets warm and we were there in November. I can't imagine August. 

We would absolutely go back!
Perfect location and right on the beach.

I really appreciated how easy it was to contact Angelica and how quickly she responded. The condo was exactly as listed, if not, better! Location was great, a little quieter and less busy. It was wonderful falling asleep to the rolling waves every night! We could see turtle and whales spouting from our Lanai! Would definitely suggest her place to anyone that wants to have a clean,
Comfortable and beautiful place to stay in maui!
Beautiful place in a beautiful area. The condo was as advertised which is all you can ask for when booking outside of a resort to have a truly authentic Hawaiian vacation.
Great property. Little local stores and park close by. Good snorkel area

Angelica's place was great.  As others have noted, there is no air conditioning; however, with the trade winds and ceiling fans the condo stayed a nice temperature. There is a farmer's market, coffee shop, and lunch places a few blacks away.  The best part was the small beach just out back.  It was perfect to spend a day at or visit after driving around the island.  Everyday that we were at this beach we saw turtles swim right next to us!

The location was incredible...small private beach, amazing sunsets, private pool and walking distance to a few stores/restaurants. On the down side, the master bedroom is close to the street, so there is road noise from the occasional bus and a steady flow of traffic. There is no AC, so the condo can get warm during the day, but it cools off at night. The blinds in the master bedroom don't close all the way, so morning sun floods the room making you an early riser...all the better to get your day on Maui started.  Overall, we had a great stay and would consider HaleKai again!

Very well located and furnished property.  Close to the nearby Honokowai park/beach (with resident turtles!), the grocery stores, great spots for restaurants and nightlife within ten minutes.  The view from the balcony is fantastic.  The unit stayed cool during the nights and mornings but did get hot in the afternoon given there is no A/C and the unit faces west.  I recommend using the fans to help with the circulation and also keeping the windows and shutters open for cross-ventilation. Would highly recommend the property!

Beautiful location - it as nice having a pool too for those of us that didn't get in the ocean.  Liked being able to walk to shops, grocery and small restaurants.  The snorkeling was really fun up and down the coastal area.  We saw lots of turtles and other sea life.
Great place, great location. Clear instructions to check-in and out. Very clean house, very nice and almost private beach. Very pleased with our stay, would recommend to everybody!
Great condo for 4 adults, perfect for our week in Maui - all as advertised, and Angelica was easy to work with from start to finish. We would definitely book it again next time.
Great host and great location!!!

Great place, very clean and modern, has everything in the kitchen and more so don't bring anything. Grocery stores and other amenities close by. Coin Laundry on site as well. Literally, steps to the ocean we didn't have to drive anywhere. Beds, linen, towels all very clean. It was perfect for 4 adults and 2 kids. We had a blast!

Amazing place, we were there for almost a month, there were turtles that came to rest on the beach some nights. I saw dolphins and whales from the lanai, the grounds are very well maintained. The beds were comfortable. We were there with our 3 small children and it was great having the park to one side and a small beach to the other side.
Great place to stay! Wonderful value. Location and oceanfront view made it perfect. Would definitely recommend!

Absolutely amazing condo !    It was true to its photos, even better!
Prefect for my husband and myself !
It absolutely wasn’t a problem not having AC!  The breeze was perfect every day !

It had everything we could have possibly needed and wanted !    

We saw so many turtles everywhere!    It was my favorite part, such amazing creatures swimming out front , and resting on the beach out front !

The pool was so nice .

The sunsets were just breathtaking every single night !

It’s ideal for a ‘middle aged’ couple !   Most people visiting were quite respectful, the locals were so welcoming, we had a fun get together by the pool one night !

We truly hope to come back ! 

Maloha !!!!!

Sue and Donny Hall.  Boston MA

Very clean apartment that is just as the photos show. No surprises here. The place was very clean, good location right by the beach, fully equipped utensils. Highly recommend this place for any type of traveler.

This was our first experience with an Airbnb and it exceeded our expectations! The views were amazing!!! The location was perfect! Rainbows, spectacular sunsets, turtles and paradise! Don’t pass this one up!

First of all we enjoyed our time at Angelica's Place very much. We loved the location and meeting fellow vacationers at the pool and BBQ. My recommendation would be to make sure you understand the condo does not have air conditioning but cools off nicely if you open the windows and turn on the fans. We slept with the windows open the entire time we were there and like one other reviewer mentioned you can hear the sounds of the ocean, birds whistling and light street traffic that acts as white noise but I would recommend bringing ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Also the washer/dryer is down stairs (not inside the condo). This is a second floor condo so all you have to do is go downstairs and the property has a small pay washer and dryer room. It has a coin machine and you can buy detergent as well. The other thing I would recommend if you are trying to stay frugal is to purchase all your supplies at Costco after you leave the airport. We purchased everything except for meat because we figured we could purchase meat for BBQ at the local market but that was a big mistake. The local Markets do not have a good selection of meats and are much more expensive. Plan your meals and get everything at Costco. (Trash bags, baggies, paper plates, red cups, lots of bottled water, sports drinks also came in very handy). I would also recommend bringing or buying a midsize soft cover ice chest to carry around snacks and bottled water. We would freeze four or five bottles of water to use as our ice and load everything around that inside the cooler and came in very handy. I also brought a large Camelback back pack which I loaded with first aid stuff, bug spray, sunscreen, lip balm, neck towels, waterproof camera, sunglasses, hats and a blue tooth speaker and always filled the water bladder. This came in very handy when we hiked the seven pools thru the bamboo forest to the waterfall. Make sure to bring good hiking shoes (not flip flops) It rained on our way back down and was very slippery/muddy so if you don't like to get wet you should consider bringing a small umbrella or light plastic poncho. Like I mentioned Angelica's place is in a great location. The balcony overlooks the pool and ocean. The beach is steps away and turtles are visible from the balcony. We literally saw a turtle everyday we were there. (nine days). The blue tooth speaker came in very handy as well. I would wake my two kids up every morning to the song from Lilo and Stitch called "Hawaiian Roller Coast Ride" and they would wake to big smiles and a great attitude for all the adventures we had while on the island. Have a great time on the island. I would recommend Angelica's place and would love to go back again some...

The view is amazing! So close to the ocean.  Sea turtles come to the rocks near the shore of the private beach. The condo is clean and modern, and the kitchen had all the utensils we needed. Highly recommend stopping at Costco for supplies prior to checking in.  Close walking distance to a fruit market, coffee shop and snorkeling supply store. The unit is a quick drive to public beaches and shopping. There is no AC, but we were here at the end of June, and the unit was comfortable. The loft is warmer, but there were enough fans to keep the kids cool.
We loved the place and the location! So close to the beach with amazing views. Easy check in and check out. Angelica is awesome and very responsive.

You have to see this place to truly appreciate it! Our family of four just returned from having stayed at this condo. You can't beat the access to the ocean and the pool is equally lovely. The décor here shows the extra care that Angelica has put into the condo - it is very stylish and comfortable. We found other guests and residents to be welcoming and free with local tips for places to eat and see. A number of restaurants and stores (including a full size grocery) are very near by. Short drives will get you to West Maui sites, including several good snorkeling or swimming beaches. The grilling area is clean and well maintained. That coupled with the fully equipped kitchen makes it easy to take meals at the condo. The lanai has great views of the pool and ocean and sunsets here are hard to beat. We even saw a few turtles in the surf. This condo is a little slice of paradise! I highly recommend it!! Also communication with Angelica was very smooth.

Amazing location and exact accurate description and photos. There’s a maintenance team onsite and cleaners in and out so secure in that regard. We had an absolutely awesome week here and will definitely return...
highly recommended. 
Thanks Angelica
love the place, great location, view, clean everything you need

The place is nice as well as the location it's an hour from the airport.  Once settled if you need a quick bite, cross the street for coffee at Bad Ass Coffee.  The Farmers Market Deli in the same location has a big selection of shakes and pickups for your home cooking.  Little expensive so try ABC or Walmart stores unless you have a Costco card.  If you have Costco buy while in the airport area, it's the nearest one from your stay.
Great location and exactly as described.  Every morning we watched the turtles and saw a few whales in the distance. The private beach was great.

Although the condo wasn’t really located in Lahina, it is a beautiful spot with amazing views. Condominium maintenance crew was quite loud in the mornings but was peaceful the majority of the time. Large kitchen with modern appliances made it extremely easy to cook meals/clean up after. Would love to come back.

Fabulous location ... minutes to Lahaina (go to Aloha Mixed Plate) and Nepali bay (go to Gazebo). Saw whales every day right from our balcony. Very quiet, friendly community. Very clean. Location, location, location!
Absolutely amazing. The condo was so nice and the space was clean and perfect for our stay and the views from the lanai were amazing. Angelica was great to communicate with.
What a wonderful place to stay

name: Grande maison avec jardin sur le Plateau
summary: Belle maison ensoleillée en plein coeur du Plateau-Mont-Royal, à deux pas du parc Lafontaine, à quelques minutes à pied du centre-ville et du Vieux Montréal, des cafés, des restaurants, des boutiques, etc.. Vous apprécierez notre grande maison, située sur une rue tranquille mais très centrale, pour son confort, son vaste jardin ombragé, sa terrasse, ses grandes portes vitrées. Notre logement est parfait pour les familles et les couples.
space: Private garden, parking lot.
description: Belle maison ensoleillée en plein coeur du Plateau-Mont-Royal, à deux pas du parc Lafontaine, à quelques minutes à pied du centre-ville et du Vieux Montréal, des cafés, des restaurants, des boutiques, etc.. Vous apprécierez notre grande maison, située sur une rue tranquille mais très centrale, pour son confort, son vaste jardin ombragé, sa terrasse, ses grandes portes vitrées. Notre logement est parfait pour les familles et les couples. Private garden, parking lot.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  5 minutes walk from the subway. Bixi bikes for rent.
neighborhood_overview: (Website hidden by Airbnb)
transit: 5 minutes walk from the subway. Bixi bikes for rent.

host.host_about: Nous sommes une famille de voyageurs établie à Montréal, une ville que nous adorons! Il nous arrive de louer notre maison, le temps d'aller explorer le monde. Bienvenue chez nous!

reviews.comments: Es war ein fantastisches Erlebnis in Karines Haus in Montreal. Wir haben uns wie zu Hause gefühlt. Die Kommunikation mit Karine verlief sehr gut und unkompliziert. Sie hat vor und während des Aufenthaltes per email nachgefragt, ob alles in Ordnung ist und weitere Tips für unseren Aufenthalt gegeben. Schon im Vorwege hatte sie gefragt, was wir gerne machen würden und uns dazu Tips gegeben, wo wir am besten einkaufen und ausgehen können und eine Liste bereit gestellt, wie alles funktioniert und wo alles zu finden ist. Die Beschreibung des Hauses  ist absolut realistisch und die Umgebung, das Plateau Mont Royal ist die neue trendische Wohn und Lebensgegend in Montreal. Wir haben mit als Familie mit 4 erwachsenen Kindern dort eine sehr schöne Woche verbracht, viel zu Fuss unternommen, Croissants beim besten Bäcker der Stadt um die Ecke gekauft und die erwachsenen Kinder in einer der angesagtesten Bars um die Ecke mit Montrealer freunden gefeiert. Obwohl so zentral gelegen, ist das Haus absolut ruhig gelegen und kein Strassengeräusch zu hören.  Bei Ankunft stand Bier und Milch für den Kaffee ein Kühlschrank und eine Tüte Kaffee für die Espressomaschine bereit. Wir können Karine und ihr Haus nur absolut empfehlen.

Our group of 3 adults and 3 children(aged 8-15) stayed for 5 nights.  With the eclectic decor and fully equipped kitchen we felt like we were staying at our friends home.  Karine offered helpful suggestions for the neighbourhood and was quick to respond with more information when asked.
The grocery is right around the corner.  Some of the cities best coffee shops, restaurants and shopping are all in close walking distance.  The metro was also close enough that we had no problem making multiple trips to and from each day, as we opted to not have a car for our trip.  
The home worked great for our family.  Two rooms with single beds accommodated my children ages perfectly.  and master was spacious.  All bedrooms had fans which we put to good use as the home does not have a/c and we were staying though a heat wave.  The backyard oasis was perfect for winding down after our days activities and our daughter loved her private backyard balcony and hammock.  The home also had plenty of other fun diversions for the kids to play with.  We very much enjoyed our stay.  
Thank you Karine and Family!

Vous allez vivre la véritable expérience Airbnb ! Karine partage sa maison familiale, et c'est comme si on était chaleureusement accueilli dans sa famille  ! Nous avons particulièrement apprécié de pouvoir passer toutes nos soirées dans le jardin, et profiter des températures plus que chaudes de cet été ! Les espaces sont spacieux et on ne sent pas à l'étroit. Le jardin et la maison étant très ombragés, malgré la canicule, la température est restée vivable ! Les nombreux ventilateurs disponibles ont fait leur job !
La cuisine est suffisamment équipée pour faire la cuisine pour 6, et le lave vaisselle est alors grandement apprécié :)
Merci à Karine et sa famille d'avoir partagé avec nous leur demeure !

name: Lovely Room In Cool and Vibrant Mile End Area!
summary: Come stay in our beautiful, spacious, and ideally located apartment!  The space is located in the heart of the cool and artsy Mile End neighbourhood, home to the best coffee shops, bars, restaurants, book stores, and vintage boutiques in Montreal! Enjoy complimentary coffee and tea, speedy and reliable WIFI,  a fully-equipped kitchen, and a cute and cuddly kitty!
space: Our Mile End apartment is the perfect place to stay while visiting Montreal.   The apartment includes one master bedroom, a beautiful and sunny office, a cozy living room, large fully equipped kitchen,  front and back balconies,  and of course a guest bedroom!  The guest room has a very comfortable double bed, night stand, large wooden desk, book shelf, and a big sunny window overlooking the front balcony.  Fresh sheets, linens, towels and soaps are provided :)  We love animals, and have a cat named Navy.  He is very sweet and friendly.  If you are traveling with a pet, let us know, and we will try to be accommodating :)  The apartment is non-smoking, but you are welcome to use either of our balconies.
description: Come stay in our beautiful, spacious, and ideally located apartment!  The space is located in the heart of the cool and artsy Mile End neighbourhood, home to the best coffee shops, bars, restaurants, book stores, and vintage boutiques in Montreal! Enjoy complimentary coffee and tea, speedy and reliable WIFI,  a fully-equipped kitchen, and a cute and cuddly kitty! Our Mile End apartment is the perfect place to stay while visiting Montreal.   The apartment includes one master bedroom, a beautiful and sunny office, a cozy living room, large fully equipped kitchen,  front and back balconies,  and of course a guest bedroom!  The guest room has a very comfortable double bed, night stand, large wooden desk, book shelf, and a big sunny window overlooking the front balcony.  Fresh sheets, linens, towels and soaps are provided :)  We love animals, and have a cat named Navy.  He is very sweet and friendly.  If you are traveling with a pet, let us know, and we will try to be accommodating :)  The
neighborhood_overview: We live in the heart of the coolest neighbourhood in Montreal!  We are half a block away from the famous St. Viateur Bagel shop.  The apartment is walking distance from tons of cute and unique shops, great restaurants, several parks, fun and fashionable clothing boutiques, and charming cafes.
transit: We are a ten minute walk from the metro station, and there is a bus stop to take you downtown right at the corner of our street!  25 minute bus ride to the centre of downtown!
access: Guest room, laundry facilities, kitchen, living room, game room, office, wifi, balconies.

host.host_about: Hi there!  I am Tessa, a coffee-blooded, fashion obsessed, animal loving, artist living and working in Montreal. I  am self employed, I own and run an Etsy shop specializing in vintage clothing, and have recently gone back to school and am studying to be jeweller. I live with my boyfriend, Trevor, who writes for a hip hop website that has offices in Montreal and New York. We are friendly and respectful and always do our best to be a great and accommodating hosts and house guests! We also have a young cat named Navy, who is very sweet and loves people!

reviews.comments: Tessa and her boyfriend were wonderful hosts. They helped us find our way around, provided us with some much needed coffee in the morning and were friendly and accomodating. The location was great, one stop from Le Plateau and four from Berri-UQAM. Would definitely stay here again! :) Thanks guys!

Tessa et son compagnon sont très sympa, malgré la petite infortune du à une incompréhension sur la petite annonce,
Ils ont un appartement sympa et parfaitement propre et si vous êtes seul leur chambre est idéal.
Merci d'avoir accepté de nous rembourser la 2eme nuit.

I had a great stay here. Trevor and Tessa are a lovely couple and were a great help when finding my feet in the city. The apartment is in a fantastic location, close to restaurants and shops. I would definitely recommend this place to bagel lovers! :)

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay (3 nights) with Tessa and Trevor. Although we did not see too much of them, when we did they were both extremely friendly and always ready to help with directions or recommendations for places to eat at or stores to visit. Their apartment is clean and cute and the neighbourhood they are in is quiet and felt really safe to walk around late at night. Mile End is a great neighbourhood - lots of interesting cafés, bakeries, two renowned bagel places, vintage stores, bars, lots of bixi bike rental stations and bike lanes. We would both definitely return in a heartbeat.
Tessa and Trevor were very friendly hosts. Bedroom was clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again!

Tessa and Trevor were both really nice hosts. They were friendly and happy to help whenever I had questions. The place has so much character and is in a great spot! It's so close to everything and Mile End is such a cool area. I would recommend staying here while you're in Montreal.

Tessa was a great host. The room and apartment were tastefully decorated and located in a perfect location for exploring Mile end  and Plateau Area. Everything was super easy and hassle free. Thanks again Tessa, Matt.
The reservation was canceled the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The reservation was canceled the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Tessa  was patient when we  came ill prepared to find her pad. She and her boyfriend made us feel welcome and offered help navigating the city's hottest spots from the first day. The house was comfortable, quiet, clean and in a great neighborhood. We hope to come back.
Tessa and Trevor were great hosts. Helpful, made us feel welcome, provided us with linens and towels. I definitely recommend!

This room with it's perfect location in lovely Mile End is highly recommendable. Both Tessa and her boyfriend are both friendly, helpful and easy going. I felt both welcome and at the same time like i had my own private space within the house.
I really enjoyed my stay, and hope to come back again some day.
/Silas

I had a nice stay at Tessa's place! Tessa and Trevor are kind people and gave good recommendations.

The location is great, a lot of awesome restaurants and music venues in the neighborhood. Also quite close to the park and easy access to other parts of Montreal.

The room has a comfortable chair and desk that's great for when you want to get some work done at home. And there is a laundry room with washer and dryer which proved to be convenient.

The only issue was that it was quite cold (especially at night), and we weren't able to get heating. Tessa did provide extra blankets but sadly didn't do much to keep me warm. I'm sure they'll get the heating fixed (as Montreal can get super cold), so shouldn't be an issue for others.

Great room in a great neighborhood, plus a cute cat. Tessa and Trevor were kind and accommodating. They helped us figure out the best places to go in Mile End, which was very appreciated. We have already recommended their apartment to our friends, and you should stay there too!

Tessa was an excellent host—her place is wonderfully decorated, comfortable enough for two, and in the best neighborhood I could ask for when visiting Montreal. Checking in was as smooth as could be. She left a super-helpful list of places to visit that perfectly suited my interests. Plus, her cat is adorable.

I stayed with Tessa and Trevor for three nights. They were very welcoming and easy going. They helped me with planning my visit, giving me heaps of advice and directions. Mile End, was great! The flat is in an awesome location and was very comfortable. Plus, the cat was very cute!
I would highly recommend the room.

We stayed at Tessas and Trevors apartment for 6 nights. Room was comfortable and apartment was beautiful, nicely decorated. She/he has definately eye for visual details!! We used room mostly for sleeping and for us it was more than sufficient. Location was perfect; bus stop is right next to apartment and it was easy to travel in Montreal. Also there was some nice restaurants and shops and Tessa gave us also helpful list of things that are nearby. Tessa gave us 100% of her help if we had any questions.

Tessa and her boyfriend were great hosts- the room was just what we needed for a getaway. It was private and in an amazing location! Thanks again Tessa and Trevor for your kindness- would highly reccomend them to friends!

Tessa and Trevor were welcoming and friendly.  Their place was warm,  clean and inviting.  They provided great recommendations on things to do in the Mile End area,  which was left for us in the room making it easy to take with us and explore the area with.  Their home was close to the bus stop and close to many great restaurants and small shops.  The bed was comfy and the room had a nice steady breeze,  making our summer nights comfortable. Would stay again and recommend!
Tessa was a nice host, she was kind and gave us a paper with some places of interest around the area. I dont have any objections, nice house, nice area and nice city.

Tessa was a great host! Communication was super easy so we didn't have to worry about anything upon arrival. Tessa was extremely understanding when my dog in all her dog clumsiness broke a lampshade, waving it off like it was no big thing (much appreciated!). 

Parking was a little annoying, there are a lot of restrictions, so if you have a car, make sure to read all the posted signs carefully! The area was super cute, Tessa's place was very centrally located and walkable to just about anywhere we wanted to go in Mile End.

Très bon séjour dans le coin à la mode de Montréal.
Bus pour aller au downtown juste à côté et direct. Pistes cyclables partout dans le quartier. De nombreuses installations sportives aussi.
L'appartement comporte 5 pièces et un balcon bien agréable au fond.
En bref : bonne expérience et idéal pour un séjour à MTL !
The host canceled this reservation 6 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This was my first time using Airbnb and it was a great first experience. Tessa and Trevor were excellent hosts! Communication was super easy and they even stayed up late to wait for us. They were welcoming and friendly from the moment we arrived; they even provided us with a list of all their recommendations in the area. The room and apartment were also exactly as pictured, Tessa really has a great eye for decorating. If you love animals, I would also recommend this place because they have an adorable and super friendly cat named Navy. As for the neighborhood, the Mile End area is really cool− it has a bunch of great restaurants and bars. Transportation was very convenient, as well. There is a bus that leaves from the corner and the Rosemont metro station is also super convenient and easy to get to. I will definitely be recommending this place to all of my friends! :)

My partner and I had a wonderful stay at Tessa's place! We were given a warm welcome upon our arrival and Navy the kitty was very lovely. It was a delightful space and awesome location! The area was very cool and Tessa had given us superb suggestions. Definitely a great experience.

We enjoyed our stay at Tessa and Trevor flat ! They are very welcoming. The flat is really charming, calm and well-located. I recommanded it for your trip in Montreal !
Ps Tessa shared the best locations and good tips in Mile-end, a great point !
Great, friendly hosts with a well looked after apartment and room. I arrived to a warm welcome, clean and tidy room and even a printed list of local recommendations. Would stay here again!

Tessa and Trevor were great, always present if needed! The room is exactly as described, superclean and the house is amazing. Sadly my stay was just one night, but i warmly suggest this stay. Navy, the cat, was also super cute!!
My husband Randy had a wonderful stay in Montreal with Tessa.

I spent a weekend at Tessa's home with my girlfriend. We were within walking distance of everything that we wanted to see and she gave us great suggestions for restaurants and bars nearby. The room is exactly like the pictures and we enjoyed the company of her extremely friendly cat Navy. Parking in Montreal is confusing so make sure you read the signs to figure out where you are allowed to park.  We would definitely recommend staying here; we loved it!

Excellent Airbnb experience! The room was cozy and very pleasant. Tessa welcomed us and provided toiletries, towels, and a very helpful list of restaurants in the area.  Mile End is a great location, and is convenient (15 min walk) to the metro.  And the cat is very friendly!

Tessa was a fantastic host - very welcoming and accommodating. We appreciated the thoughtful touches in the room as well: a list of nearby restaurants, travel toiletries, etc. We'd be happy to stay with her again!
Tessa made me feel beyond welcomed. I can recommend the place to everyone, the neighborhood is amazing, a lot of nice cafés and shops.

I LOVED staying with Tessa and Trevor in Montreal! Their place is in a great location, it's beautifully decorated, and completely clean, quiet, welcoming, and pleasant. The bed is super comfortable: an easy place to crash after a day in the city. Tessa also has lots of great neighborhood recommendations (thank you SO much for that!) and their cat is adorable. This was the perfect place for me to stay during my trip to Montreal!

They were also super accommodating when I was running late getting to their place when I first got to town--I was having navigation issues and some traffic holding me up, but they were really understanding about it.

I would love to stay with them again! Thanks, Tessa!!!
Great value stay, amazing location and very kind and friendly hosts. A great first stay in Montreal.

I really enjoyed staying in Montreal. Tessa was a great host!
Thank you so much!
This was the perfect location! Exactly what we were looking for. Tessa was very accommodating! Thanks for everything!!

Tessa and Trev’s place was lovely! They were very welcoming and made me feel at home straight away. The location was beautiful and near so many nice places to eat, grocery stores etc. There was a bus stop practically right outside. The room is beautifully decorated, but if you have a lot of luggage it might be a bit small (there is no closet). Tessa and Trev were great hosts, and were happy to have a chat or leave me to my own devices if I needed space. Would highly recommend!

name: Very special island bed and brunch
summary: A  new exquisite guest bathroom for you to enjoy, a king sized heated waterbed, air conditioning or heating or 3/4 single bed with innersprung mattress.  Both beds have sheepskin overlays - cosy or cool - your choice.   Experience the Hawkesbury River first hand. Hire a tinny, orwith a licence, a  fishing boat.  Bed, shower, brunch $140 per night, per person. This includes a lavish Brunch, with local fare, provided by the owner, who stays to look after you.   Customer happiness is paramount!
space: Here is your unique opportunity to stay in a delightful heritage home loved by the owners for 44 years, reflecting over 125 years of history, but with modern conveniences.  Enjoy your food on a veranda overlooking the river and listen to the local birds.  There are two bedrooms, compact but charming.  Clean, comfortable beds and somewhere to store your belongings.  There is a Snug with TV and a wide choice of dvds and cds.  Sparkling new bathroom just for you - you have big fluffy towels.  Stroll onto the verandas, lounge around inside, loll in bed late - no pressure to do anything.  Your hosts are a retired opera singer and an author, who will chat to you or leave you in peace, as you wish.   You can be waited on and enjoy a delicious brunch..  Ann will give you a 20 minute history talk and tour of the house only if you request.  This traffic free island is usually peaceful except for the multi coloured birds that are encouraged in the permaculture, award - winning garden. Brunch on t
description: A  new exquisite guest bathroom for you to enjoy, a king sized heated waterbed, air conditioning or heating or 3/4 single bed with innersprung mattress.  Both beds have sheepskin overlays - cosy or cool - your choice.   Experience the Hawkesbury River first hand. Hire a tinny, orwith a licence, a  fishing boat.  Bed, shower, brunch $140 per night, per person. This includes a lavish Brunch, with local fare, provided by the owner, who stays to look after you.   Customer happiness is paramount! Here is your unique opportunity to stay in a delightful heritage home loved by the owners for 44 years, reflecting over 125 years of history, but with modern conveniences.  Enjoy your food on a veranda overlooking the river and listen to the local birds.  There are two bedrooms, compact but charming.  Clean, comfortable beds and somewhere to store your belongings.  There is a Snug with TV and a wide choice of dvds and cds.  Sparkling new bathroom just for you - you have big fluffy towels.  Stroll o
neighborhood_overview: A mostly quiet neighbourhood of different nationalities, used to tourists and friendly and helpful with one village shop which has very good coffee and light meals. Some Friday nights there might be a party at the club - if it's noisy, sorry this is out of our control.
notes: Our house is not a museum, however we have carefully preserved the centre as a heritage showpiece with original furniture, rare photographs and documents.  Ann Howard has written for books about the island history and made two short films.  She is happy to give you a talk and walk at your request as part of your memorable stay.  The majority of people come to Ann's place to 'crash' but there are some enthusiastic history buffs!
transit: Car or train to Hawkesbury River Station, then ferry or taxi across - usually straight to Dangar Island, sometimes to Wobby Beach first. Details on request. very special island bed and brunchDangar Island, NSW, AustraliaA new exquisite guest bathroom for you to enjoy. If you'd like to experience the Hawkesbury River first hand, you can hire a tinny, or if you have a licence, a party pontoon or fishing boat. Be...
access: You are welcome to all of the garden and most of the house. We have a large varied library, dvds, dartboard, games and a light show of our own.  We are next to the park and a few minutes walk to two beaches. You can swim in the river at high tide.Wind down and listen to the rhythms of nature or walk, paddle, fish, bush walk or catch the River Postman upriver.
interaction: I offer English lessons by the hour - conversation, cooking or formal English by arrangement.  I am a highly qualified and experienced teacher.   It's a great location for sketching and photography.  Beautiful sunsets.   Guests caVn be as quiet as they like, play music, darts or dvds or chat with us - it's their holiday!  So they choose. Get up when they like, go to bed when they like.
house_rules: We want you to enjoy the fresh air, so no smoking in the house or garden please.  Occasionally there are mozzies.  There is a net over your bed in this case. You are welcome to read the books and magazines, just replace them when you are done.

host.host_location: Dangar Island, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about: We are used to international travellers as my husband was a well known opera singer in Europe, so feel assured that any special needs will be catered for.  Looking forward to meeting you. Ann

reviews.comments: My overall experience on Dangar Island was wonderful. Ann created a sense of being cared for, in a relaxed environment. Ann is a wonderful and interesting host with great historical knowledge of the local area. Meal time was fun; some of the food picked from the garden, the rest fresh, delicious and made to suit my individual requirements. Eating breakfast overlooking a pretty garden and watching the river made a pleasurable start to each day. My bed was comfortable and as promised by my host, big soft towels to use in the shared bathroom. The house itself is as interesting as its gracious host and well worth the short ferry ride to visit and stay in for a night or two. Most enjoyable!

We had a wonderful time staying with Ann at her amazing, historic and endlessly fascinating house. She even cooked Korean food for Minji, making her own version of KimChi! Her attention to detail and desire to ensure her guests have a great time makes Ann the consummate host. We thoroughly recommend a visit to this hidden treasure only 55min north of Sydney.

Upon disembarking the adorable wooden ferry on Dangar Island, the charm of the island operates… boat shacks and pontoons line the shore, houses hide away among the luxuriant greenery… We are met by wonderful Ann at the cafe, and while she takes us to the house telling us all about the island, we already feel looked after and start winding down. The heritage house, very well loved by the owners, is all at once comfortable/cosy, charming and full of wonders… some delicious like: fresh herbs, lemon/orange trees growing in the garden. The'Platypus" bedroom with its timber walls, vintage lacy mosquito net, clean bed linen & soft towels, made us feel very snug. Ann had even placed some fresh lavender stems on our pillows! We explored the island during the day, hanged at the beach… It felt like the time had stopped for a while. Then, coming back to the house, we were welcomed at night by Ann cooking up a FEAST, literally. She put so much thoughts into the menu and what would please us! The dinner with Ann and her husband was lovely and very much fun. Needless to say that we slept like babies. The next day morning brunch was another delicious meal served on the sunny balcony overlooking the vegetation and the river. We left shortly after and felt we could have stayed for a few more days of true pampering!

We couldn't have hoped for a more peaceful, beautiful setting for a weekend out of the city. Ann was a very warm and generous host who went out of her way to accommodate our interests including researching a suitable track in ku ring gai national park, and cooking a bevy of delicious vegetarian meals (complete with home grown herbs, veggies and chili!).

Dangar island itself houses a warm and friendly community and it was very special to have a host who is so proud and knowledgeable about her corner of the world. We look forward to our next stay!
Ann and her family were the most gracious of hosts, sharing their house, gorgeous food & (mostly bad) jokes to make me feel a part of the family.

Ann is a great host. We felt welcome. She is a local historian and gave us a great insight into the island. 
The place and location are good. We felt at home. We were very warm at night and it was quite romantic for us. 
We were on the island for other reasons and would recommend it to others, although I would say that it is fully priced.

Ann was a very welcoming a thoughtful host. Also a great local historian who shared stories of the early days of the island. The hot breakfast with ham, cheese, fresh fruit and croissants and a perfect egg was a particular highlight. 

Highly recommended! A++

The island itself is small and delightful, with the ferry ride across at dusk just lovely. We also highly recommend hiring a tinnie from Brooklyn to explore the river.

We had a lovely time at Ann's place. Ann and her husband are very interesting and considerate hosts. Lots of lively conversation. A lovely brunch.  Both rooms made up for us nicely. Great communication through the booking process.

Ann and her husband met us at the ferry and upon arrival I was presented with a surprise birthday cake! How fabulous. Gluten free too for me - very thoughtful indeed. A lovely birthday card too left on the dresser. It's personal touches like this that make for a great stay.

So nice to know a bit about the history of where you're staying. Ann does a great talk on the history of the island.

If you think you'll need a little sleep in, take earplugs as the local birds get excited in the morning. A wonderful symphony to wake up to, but if you're trying to sleep...  

Dangar Island is just wonderful - we keep coming back. It is a truly special place.

We'll  come again - both to the island and would happily stay here again.

Ann and Robert are charming hosts! From preparing our favourite foods to allowing us free range of the house and garden and sharing a lovely glass of wine over great conversation, we were made to feel really at home, yet really special. Both the house and the hosts are fascinating—Ann is a font of local history knowledge and Robert's collection of classical music is breathtaking. Beautiful artistic touches are everywhere, making this a truly magical and unique place to stay.

We had a lovely time at Ann and Robert's on Dangar Island. Ann and Robert are both extraordinary people - fascinating and inspiring! We listened to Robert's opera CD on our way home! Ann made the most beautiful brunch for us. Their historic home is warm and inviting. Thankyou for a lovely time :)
Ann was a gracious host and a fantastic cook. She was very good company and her place is ideally located - very near the wharf, cafe, and bowling club as well as just a short walk to the beach.
Thanks so much Ann for being such a perfect hostess - I loved your cooking and was inspired by your garden. Maree

A cultural experience to be enjoyed and treasured. Definitely to be on the bucket list of anyone who enjoys diversity and appreciates the finer things in life such as being entertained by a knowledgeable hostess who can share the wonders of permaculture, the arts and history. loved and appreciated every second thank you Ann for opening your home and loving us so dearly.

Ann was the perfect host.  From the welcome smile, to the beautiful breakfast and the awesome surroundings, we were not disappointed.  Dangar island is beautiful and the weekend was made even more special by how well Ann looked after us.  Everything was as described and this place is full of history.  Definitely worth a visit
Gorgeous little treasure Dangar is! Ann is generous in sharing her little paradise, her amazing knowledge and stories. We will be back.
A charming B&B with lots of history and character. Ann took care of us and spoilt us with a lovely breakfast each morning. Not great for young families, but lovely for a couple.
Heritage house with a lovely host!

Ann's place is unique, historical and a memorable place to stay.  We enjoyed the history of the house, the stories told by Ann and the very genuine concern for our comfort on what was a 41 degree day.  Breakfast was delicious and tailored to our needs.  Thanks Ann for a lovely stay.
Lovely hosts on a beautiful island

We booked online through Air BNB for two adults and one infant.  Unfortunately, soon after we arrived, Ann told us there had been a billing error and asked for more money, stating we had not booked correctly online and had only paid half of what we should have. 
We showed her our booking confirmation to prove we had booked correctly, and she “let us stay”. We had booked and paid correctly, it appears there may have been a problem with the Air BNB site. However, from this point on staying there became very uncomfortable.
Over the next couple of days there were more problems. She could not tell us the wifi password, so we were unable to use the wifi. She told us we could not use the air conditioning. Finally, she refused us access to the kitchen to heat up our dinner, and told us we could not eat in the house, so we ended up eating cold pies in the garden at night. 
It was so uncomfortable we decided to leave early, and did not stay the last night.

Review:
Ann was a thoughtful, generous  host with a sense of humour.  We had a freshly painted bedroom with heated king sized waterbed overlooking a marvellous garden by the river.  We stayed in bed until mid-morning. The buffet was enough food for the day!  She had local honey, home-made yoghurt and fruit and herbs fresh from the garden to make teas also top coffee.  Her house is packed with treasures and stories about the island and the Hawkesbury.  We'll be back!!
Ann's place could not be more central to the heart of the island - the Bowlo ! Really easy to find and walk around. Very clean and spacious

Ann is a gracious and generous host, with a charming house uniquely positioned to enjoy a trip to Dangar Island. Close to the wharf, the cafe/shop and the Bowling Club, we chose to stay with Ann after a day on the water and thoroughly enjoyed it. Ann's knowledge of the Island's history is second-to-none and her hospitality is amazing - putting on a delicious breakfast for us in the morning.
Thanks Ann for a wonderful time.  Dangar Island is an absolute gem, made even better by your hospitality, excellent meals and fascinating historic house.
Lovely location.  And lovely hosts. And a special garden cutting to remember our short break!  Thanks Ann for a lovely holiday

Dangar Island has a special quality of itself, and there is probably nowhere better to experience it than Ann's home. With a style and atmosphere that is warm and inviting, overlooking the beautiful Hawkesbury this is a great place to just watch to boats go by from the balcony or, if you like, get the lowdown on the history of the island or a tour of the garden. Thanks Ann also for going to so much trouble to accommodate for my vegan dietary requirements!
Amazing stay! Loved the heated waterbread and fresh fruit from Anne's garden for brekkie
Great host, stilish home in great location, water views . Highly recommended. Great food at brunch. Thank you Ann and Robert. See you again soon. Luca
PEICE AN OUITE IHOPE DEVELOPERS NEVER FIND TH IS PART OF GODS COUNTRY
Ann is a very special person and you will learn a lot about the Island from her. She makes us feel like home. Her garden is also excellent.

name: Cozy Apartment in Bed-Stuy
summary: We are close to A, C Subways, Fort Greene Park, YMCA gym, grocery stores, great restaurants . You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, the hospitality, the ambiance. My place is good for couples and solo adventurers.
space: Getting Around The subway station is right around the corner. It literally takes 3 mins to get to the station. You can even see the station from the balcony. Other Things to Note Keep in mind that you will have the privacy of your own bedroom. I will be staying on the second floor. But it's like I'm not even there! You can access the tv room, kitchen, balcony, bathroom, etc.

My place is good for couples and solo adventurers. Getting Around The subway station is right around the corner. It literally takes 3 mins to get to the station. You can even see the station from the balcony. Other Things to Note Keep in mind that you will have the privacy of your own bedroom. I will be staying on the second floor. But it's like I'm not even there! You can access the tv room, kitchen, balcony, bathroom, etc. You will be staying in our Guest Bedroom and have access to the kitchen, living room and 2 full bathrooms. We are very friendly and enjoy getting to know all our guests!  Check out some of our previous reviews from our old airbnb account.... We are 5 blocks away from the C train and 8 blocks away from the A train.  These trains take you straight to Washington Square park, World Trade Center, 3
transit: We are 5 blocks away from the C train and 8 blocks away from the A train.  These trains take you straight to Washington Square park, World Trade Center, 34th Street Penn Station, Times Square, and Columbus Circle (Central Park).
access: You will be staying in our Guest Bedroom and have access to the kitchen, living room and 2 full bathrooms.
interaction: We are very friendly and enjoy getting to know all our guests!  Check out some of our previous reviews from our old airbnb account....

reviews.comments: Stass and élani are very Nice ,  Thanks you .

Leni was very well coming. The flat was very tidy and the room was very comfortable. Perfect for a couple or a single person. She helped us with every request.
The location is very suitable. The flat is approx. 10 minutes away from the nearest subway station and 35 minutes by subway to 34th street.
Eleni's place is in the heart of Brooklyn and a cosy home base for the young crowd. Eleni and her roommates are helpful and fun people, thank you very much, we had a great time.

Finding the apartment was a breeze. Communication with Eleni was easy and always timely. She was very accomadating as we arrived later than I had originally stated. The room was perfect and exactly as mentioned. My dad and I enjoyed talking with the roommates after returning from the city one night. The apartment/flat has a very welcoming vibe.
Great room in good location in Brooklyn close to subway lines. Really friendly housemates

Eleni's place was very nice and cozy. Roommates were very friendly and helpful. The room had only one window on the ceiling and I didn't quite like that. Except that, eveything was great! I enjoyed my stay .
Awesome

name: Charmoso loft em Santa Teresa
summary: Nosso apartamento é super aconchegante, acomoda 4 pessoas confortavelmente. Temos ainda um colchão inflável de casal que pode acomodar mais 2. É claro e arejado. Fica a poucos metros do largo dos Guimaraes, onde ficam os bares mais badalados do bairro e por onde o famoso bondinho passa.
space: Ar condicionado no quarto e sala. 2 vagas de garagem. Opção de diarista durante a hospedagem se necessário.
description: Nosso apartamento é super aconchegante, acomoda 4 pessoas confortavelmente. Temos ainda um colchão inflável de casal que pode acomodar mais 2. É claro e arejado. Fica a poucos metros do largo dos Guimaraes, onde ficam os bares mais badalados do bairro e por onde o famoso bondinho passa. Ar condicionado no quarto e sala. 2 vagas de garagem. Opção de diarista durante a hospedagem se necessário. Tv a cabo, Wi-Fi, máquina de lavar. Diariamente Bar do mineiro tem um pastel de feijão delicioso!! Bar dos descasados em frente! Bar do gomes! Largo do Curvelo e largo das Neves, Parque das ruínas são pontos turísticos  muito visitados e o imperdível bondinho de Santa Tereza que está sendo reformado! Sim, ônibus com destino ao centro da cidade e bondinho. Além de ponto de táxi e Uber.

transit: Sim, ônibus com destino ao centro da cidade e bondinho. Além de ponto de táxi e Uber.
access: Tv a cabo, Wi-Fi, máquina de lavar.
interaction: Diariamente
house_rules: Deixa lá em bom estado. Taxa de limpeza de entrada e saída.

host.host_location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

name: Reduced! Special deal $119 Free Wifi
summary: Kauai Beach Resort located along miles of secluded beach in Lihue, Hawaii. Lihue Airport and the towns of Wailua and Lihue are 4 miles from the hotel Naupaka Terrace, the hotel's signature restaurant, offers premium-choice aged beef & local seafood.
description: Kauai Beach Resort located along miles of secluded beach in Lihue, Hawaii. Lihue Airport and the towns of Wailua and Lihue are 4 miles from the hotel Naupaka Terrace, the hotel's signature restaurant, offers premium-choice aged beef & local seafood. No daily maid service.
notes: No daily maid service.
house_rules: - Strict cancellation rules

host.host_about: I am a chinese girl from Malaysia..love to travel and find good deals and having fun.

reviews.comments: Had a great stay here. Very nice property with lots of amenities and close to all the hot spots.  Room was very comfortable and clean.

Our stay at Kauai Beach Resort (KBR) was great, and although we never met our host Molly - we didn't need to - the accommodation is a privately owned unit within a first class resort!!!! We checked in like all the other guests and had full use of all the resort facilities in an idyllic setting - multiple swimming pools and dining areas, one with live music most nights & there were 2 weddings down on the beach in the week we stayed - really is a BEAUTIFUL spot. Having said all of the above my one piece of advice would be "book a car rental BEFORE you arrive!!!!!"
There is a free shuttle from and to the Lihue airport and also to a local shopping centre (crap), but for such a small island there is so much to do and see and we were starting to get cabin fever as we had to wait 3 days for a rental car (limited number on the island or maybe our stay was in peak season???

It is a perfect place to stay on Kauai. We actually haven't met her but the check-in went easily. As well you can use the pool and fitness as any other hotel gast which was a huge plus! Make sure you rent a car and this will be your perfect spot to be!

The Kauai Beach Resort never disappoints and neither did Molly's unit. It was a beautiful room with a partial view of the ocean, you could see enough of the ocean and hear it from the patio. We utilized this serene environment and ate breakfast on the patio daily. Molly was great at communicating what our room would be like, so there were no surprises. I would highly recommend Molly's unit for a great escape to paradise.
Molly has both hotel rooms and villas.  Make sure you choose the option you want.  Molly is very responsive and an excellent host.  She addressed all of our issues promptly and without question.
The room is old Fashion and has a nice balcony. They charge you Parking Fee of 25.00 US $ per Night! The resort is very clean and has several Pools.

Very quiet and clean and you have access to everything at the resort!  Beautiful view of ocean and mountains.  We loved every minute of our stay and only wished we could stay longer.  In the amenities it says there is no hair dryer, but I double checked with Molly and there is one, so don't worry about needing to waste precious suitcase space. We walked the short distance out to the ocean, it was very beautiful, with almost nobody else out there. Everyone that worked at the resort was SO NICE.
This room was wonderful! Perfect location next to the beach, and central to all the best spots on Kauai.

Absolutely loved staying here. Beautiful beach view, centrally located on the island. It would be best to rent a car to get around and see the sights. Renting a private home you do not get amenities like free parking and airport shuttle, but you can rent a car from the airport and pay $25 parking fee and have everything you need. We will definitely be back.

The listing states "studio style condo". This is a hotel room, not a condo. No refrigerator. Parking is $25.00 per day valet or self park, plus tax. The resort is great, minutes to town and the airport.

This was a great opportunity to stay at a major top-class resort at a discounted rate. The experience was essentially identical to that of other resort guests -- the only tradeoff was lack of daily maid service (you can opt for that if you want it) and there was one happy hour with free mai tais  that private party guests were not eligible for (again, no big deal ). I would highly recommend this to anyone else.

Kauai Beach Resort is great! The pools and the views are wonderful. Staff is very friendly and helpful. This room is nice, clean, and well appointed. You can see the ocean from the balcony if you look left. Straight down and to the right you see a smoking area and the back side of the hotel, but we weren't disturbed by any noise or smoke. Would love to stay here again.
Excellent location and resort! Had a great time!

This place was even better than it looks in the pictures!!! The hotel itself is super cute with three separate places to eat. Only about 10 minutes away from a great swimming beach as well as 10 minutes from shopping and restaurants in the other direction! Some people mentioned that the furniture it out of date, it just felt like classic Hawaiian style to me. I won't lie the room had a weird smell but I think it might be from the dampness on Kauai combined with the cleaner used and maybe running the AC. Not sure but it wasn't anything horrible!! Definitely stay here it's a great value the property is beautiful and the room is great!!
Great place but parking was expensive and in poor shape.
First time booking with Molly and it won't be the last :) Really enjoyed the place!  Courteous staff, clean facility, etc...

Very romantic place for a couple to
stay right off the beach and convenient by rental car to enjoy sights of Kauai! Host responds to questions very quickly and the staff at this resort is amazing!
Great resort. Great amenities and access to the ocean. Loved it.
Nice room. Loved Kauai!

The carpet was new and nice, and bed is comfortable. I stay at this resort often and it's in a great location.  Slight view of ocean to the left from room,  parking lot view to the right.  There was a loud humming coming from the floor below.  I paid $150 for a cleaning fee so thought that included daily housekeeping but no it did not... so there was no cleaning during my stay unless I wanted to pay an extra charge.  The listing also said that  the resort fee was included, and I know because I stay there often, that that includes a free shuttle to the airport but private guest cannot use the free shuttle.
Great resort. The pool is fantastic
Wonderful place and location! Beautiful resort and easy access to the whole island.
Nice large hotel style room in large resort complex . Everything was as expected .

Highly recommend. Beautiful resort with pools, beach front, spa and restaurants.  Great location to get around Kauai. Parking is high but that is standard in the area. FYI you pay the resort fee but do not get al the resort perks but you’re not missing much there. Definitely book!

Molly's place is logistical bliss, wrapped in watching the waves crash on the ocean while drinking a local beer, with a dash of not too overpowering but still formal hotel experience and service. Plus its Kauai. If there's anything about the place you don't love, you're not trying.

On a more serious note: the amenities here are top notch. The wifi, for instance, was fast and reliable enough for me to get work done in between outings. Laundry: check. Bar/restaurant (you don't have to leave the grounds for): check. I am always vaguely concerned when a host is hands-off, but in reality, the KBR staff can and will help you with whatever your dysfunction is and do so with a smile. Don't let this tremendous opportunity pass you by.

Advertised as an apartment, in reality we got a room.  6 days in a room with tiny soap, tiny shampoo, no real cooking facilities.  We couldn’t bring our own stuff to poolside because place was a resort hotel not an apartment complex.  Bedding stank of old sweat.  Cleaners came after being called.  They did change all pillows and comforter.  Stink went away
Resort was excellent as was Molly.
Great place!

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Overall, we had a very nice time. The Resort was accurately represented with a very nice pool, helpful concierge and centrally located to many places. The negatives that we found were the sliding doors were extremely loud and rough to close and the walls were very thin so we could hear every movement in the room next door. She does let you know that there isn’t daily cleaning in this room; however, if you’re here for hiking expect to get quite dirty while you’re out. We would’ve found it helpful to have clean towels more often.

The location was less than 5 minutes from the airport. The pools were amazing—I was surprised how much time we spent there! Comfortable conditions and close to restaurants and activities. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone traveling to Kauai.

Our stay went well! The room is pretty much a standard hotel room, which we were aware of. We had three nights and my boyfriend and I were sad to leave the king size bed, coffee maker, pool, and the nearby beach. The location was great and it was the right pricing for us since it was discounted. We would totally stay again.

Great location and value just outside of Lihue, less crowded and lots of private beach line!
Very clean, very nice, great pools and property, would definitely stay here again!
We had a great stay with our toddler. The pools were amazing, the room was clean and there was a decent gym!

Molly's place was a great place to stay.  It was clean and centrally located so you could enjoy the many things that are to do in and around Kauai.  The pools are awesome and the staff was very helpful and friendly.
The nicest property in Lihue hands down. Awesome resort. Great value!!

We stayed 10 nights and it was a comfortable and relaxing vacation. We thought the room was a good size and the amount of towels was sufficient even with all of the activities we did (including multiple days of hiking in mud). We didn't need to do laundry during our stay but it's available at the resort for a fee. Overall, the resort was great. The location, pool and access to the parking lot was awesome. We would definitely stay again especially with the affordable price tag.
Everything was perfect as said in the description.

We spent a few days at Mollys place and were quite surprised how good it was. We loved to stay in the resort and really liked our room. I never got a personal message from Molly, so I wished to have some communication or at least one message. Otherwise I would definitely go again!
Great stay in a beautiful resort! We would go back and definitely recommend staying here!
Location, room and resort were great! Molly was a great host. Look forward to staying there again.

The pool and amenities at the resort are amazing!!!  The beach was great for long walks or runs!  The room was clean and close to the pools. The location was central to everything!!!  I would definitely go back.

It is not mentioned in the initial advertisement that this room is located in Kauai Beach Resort - which was a beautiful and pleasant surprise but was confusing while trying to find the place. Amazing location and very convenient with 3 restaurants just down stairs, 4 pools, 2 hot tubs and the ocean in sight. Additional fees were not mentioned that you should be cautious of such as $25USD a day to park at the resort (no where else to park), also extra fees for additional towels/toilet paper. Overall beautiful stay, the staff at the resort are incredibly helpful/friendly.

The unit is located in the complex very well. Easy to get everywhere and relaxing to hang out at. Balcony ocean views are a nice touch. Comfortable bed. Quiet area.. except for the roosters. The resort is very friendly. The food served was very good. Tuesday afternoon Hula and music was well done and fun. Happy hours were also great for meeting folks over $7 MaiTais. It's the staff here that will make you want to return.    Being North of Lihue worked well too. You can be an hour from most places. Traffic jams up 2 - 5 but you find yourself out of it if you leave at 9. Back in the Hot tub with hot water falling on your smiling face at 3. It's a great location!

Molly's p!ace is very good value for your money.  I would have liked to see additional bath towels...we were given 3 to use for our five days there.  You can pay for extra if you choose. Parking is an additional $25 per day and I would recommend a car, so that increases the price a bit. You can self-park for the day in the non-valet area for free, but must have a permit for night parking. The king sized bed was comfortable.  Thanks Molly for a good time.

name: Apartment in the centre with parking
summary: This apartment it is where I live. It is right in the centre, near the pedestrian part of the main street of the centre-Rua de Santa Catarina. However it is a very quiet building and you don't listen any noise... It is near metro station where guests can arrive directly from Porto Airport ( Francisco Sá Carneiro Airport ). The neigborhood have cafés, cheap and typical restaurants, groceries, and supermarkets. If you need the garage, please mention it when you make the reservation.
space: The living-room have 1 sofa-bed where can sleep 1 person.
description: This apartment it is where I live. It is right in the centre, near the pedestrian part of the main street of the centre-Rua de Santa Catarina. However it is a very quiet building and you don't listen any noise... It is near metro station where guests can arrive directly from Porto Airport ( Francisco Sá Carneiro Airport ). The neigborhood have cafés, cheap and typical restaurants, groceries, and supermarkets. If you need the garage, please mention it when you make the reservation. The living-room have 1 sofa-bed where can sleep 1 person. The building have elevator from the garage to the apartment. From the Airport, guests can catch the metro until Campo 24 de Agosto metro station. From that metro station to the apartment it is 5 minuts walking. The metro trip takes around 45 minuts. Please let us know your flight details, for we can manage your arrival. If you come by car, please let us know more or less what time you will arrive in Porto. We are not all the time at home.
transit: From the Airport, guests can catch the metro until Campo 24 de Agosto metro station. From that metro station to the apartment it is 5 minuts walking. The metro trip takes around 45 minuts. Please let us know your flight details, for we can manage your arrival. If you come by car, please let us know more or less what time you will arrive in Porto. We are not all the time at home.
access: The building have elevator from the garage to the apartment.

host.host_about: I am guy who like my city and enjoy everything what Porto offered. INto art, architecture, theater and contemporary dance...

reviews.comments: This is a great apartment slightly outside the main part of Porto but incredibly easy to walk to in under ten minutes from all the main tourist spots. Our host was great meeting us and taking the time to show us where things were located and making some great recommendations. We chose to drive through Portugal and this place has very secure parking in the building which was a great find. The apartment also has a great look and feel while being in a very quiet building. Highly recommend if you want something close by and quiet.

Alcino was a great host. He was very helpful with planning our days out. We had a map with a couple of different routes specified depending on what we were interested in. Beautiful apartment, the shutters on the windows were magical. Great super secure parking as well and Porto was just amazing to explore. Such a good looking city. Highly recommended.

Alcino was a very welcome host. He descirbed all details regarding public transport in Porto and how to get from airport to the apartment. As our fly was delayed he wait for us more then 1 hour at night. The location of the apartment is near city center. It's very easy to go everywhere by foot. Apartment is very big, comfortable with a nice view.  We spent a great week in Porto and strongly recommend Alcino as a host.

Très bon séjour dans un appartement au calme, avec volets (nuit noire!!!) très proche des transports en commun, restaurants, mini super marchés, à 10 mn à pied du marché de Bolhao. Facile d'accès à partir de l'aéroport en métro. Décoration soignée et originale.

Le calme et le confort de l'appartement compensent la distance (toute relative-10 mns à pied) du centre ville. L'existence d'un parking est un atout précieux. Un excellent endroit pour se détendre et se reposer entre deux promenades.

El apartamento está bastante bien situado. Limpio, y tal y como aparece en las fotos . Todo correcto, excepto la entrega de llaves cuando llegamos. Envie varios emails diciendo que llegaria sobre las 16 h. Al final llegamos 1  hora antes, y la persona encargada de llevarnos las llaves( no era el propietario, ya que estaba fuera de la ciudad), nos puso problemas con la hora. Llego a las 16:45 , despues de intercambiar washap queriendo alargar la hora de darnos las llaves ( nos llegó a decir que a las 18:45.. que fueramos a dar una vuelta foz.. ,mientras esperabamos su llegada, aparccamos, y la zona era de pago (no lo sabiamos, pues las rayas de la carretera eran blancas ) y nos pusieron una multa de 12 €.  con el consiguiente gran enfado por mi parte, ya que si hubiera estado a la hora indicada esto no hubiera sucedido.
Por lo demas, el apartamento, es tal y como muestran las fotos.
We had a lovely time at Alcino's place, the apartment is very cozy and close to the city center, and we got great tips about places to see in Porto from his friend Pedro who received us.

Wir haben uns sehr willkommen gefühlt. Pedro hat uns auf einem Stadtplan viel gezeigt und ausführliche sehr gute Tipps gegeben. Am besten war Matosinho!!! Leute, geht da unbedingt hin - es ist ein Genuß, dort Fisch zu essen.

El piso de Alcino está muy bien situado a apenas 5 minutos andando del centro . La vivienda es confortable y tiene una decoración muy cuidada. Pedro, un amigo de Alcino, fue muy simpático y atento cuando nos entregó las llaves y nos hizo recomendaciones muy útiles para disfrutar de Oporto.

Très bonne surprise en arrivant a Porto. Nous pensions être un peu excentré, mais au contraire l'emplacement était parfait calme et dans le centre. A deux pas de la rue piétonne Catarina. Excellent accueil avec pleins de conseils sur les centres d'intérêt de la ville et ses transports. Appartement impeccable même pour une famille.

Tout s'est très bien passé avec Alcino (malgré que nous nous sommes pas rencontrés). Appartement très bien situé à 5min à pied de la rue Santa Catharina. Le parking privé est un gros plus. Appartement conforme.

El apartamento es una  casa, amplia y con todas las comodidades. Está céntrica y acogedora. Cuida mucho el detalle. Nos recibió un amigo de Alcino, muy agradable, Pedro y nos ayudo a orientarnos con mucha amabilidad.

La casa esta en una ubicacion perfecta centrica y dispone de un muy buen parking privado dentro del precio. Pedro nos atendio muy educadamente incluso espero un retraso por nuestra parte de 40 min a la llegada. Un apartamento limpio y ordenado.
Todo muy bien!Pedro un amigo de alcino un anfitrión inmejorable.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Appartement agréable et sécurisé. Excellente literie. Parking privé  en sous-sol. Rue commerçante sainte catherine à 6 ou 7 mn à pied. Centre et monuments accessibles à pied. Le Douro également mais plus loin. Une adresse correcte, un logement spacieux.
Alcino ha sido un anfitrión correcto. Ha sido muy flexible en el horario de entrada lo que le agradecemos.

Nos atendió Pedro, un chico muy amable amigo de Alcino, nos explicó muy bien el piso y qué hacer y visitar en oporto y sus alrededores. El apartamento está en una buena zona, junto a muchos servicios y relativamente cerca de las zonas a visitar.

Bien situado. La plaza de garaje genial. Mejoraria varias cosas por la seguridad de la estancia en el apartamento. Hay cosas importantes que deben ser corregidas lo antes posible. Si se arreglan el piso es un 10, pero deben corregirse.

Nous avons été très bien accueillies par Pedro, un ami d’Alcino. Le logement est très bien situé, à 5 minutes à pieds de la rue Santa Catarina (rue commerçante), 10 mn de la gare centrale, au calme et bien équipé. Les lits sont confortables. Pedro a pris le temps de nous montrer quels étaient les points à visiter aux alentours et nous a renseigné sur les transports en commun de Porto. Le seul point négatif est que, malgré des draps et du linge de toilette propres, le logement n’avait pas été nettoyé avant notre arrivée. Nous avons lavé les sols, les sanitaires, le frigo et le coin cuisine. La femme de ménage est venue le 6eme jour et a laissé le logement très propre, elle a changé les draps et les serviettes. La chasse d’eau des toilettes a besoin d’être réparé. Malgré cela, nous gardons un bon souvenir de notre séjour dans ce logement.
Bom espaço e boa localização

name: One bdrm apt in Central/Sheung Wan next to Soho
summary: Located between Hollywood and Caine Road, just down from Soho bars/restaurants and not far from Wyndham St. and LKF nightlife. 5 minute walk to the escalator. Good for travelling couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
description: Located between Hollywood and Caine Road, just down from Soho bars/restaurants and not far from Wyndham St. and LKF nightlife. 5 minute walk to the escalator. Good for travelling couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. - pool passes will be available upon check-in to the flat; accessible hours will be communicated I can be reached via (Hidden by Airbnb) (+ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and email (Email hidden by Airbnb) once a reservation has been made. The neighborhood is relatively quiet, especially on the 11th floor, however there are restaurants at the base of the block. Within a 5-minute walk in any direction there are many options for food and drink. MTR (subway) is roughly a 10-minute walk although times can vary going to and from the flat depending on the route; note that the flat is located on a slope and all MTR locations are at the base of said slope; access to the escalator leading to Central MTR station is  encouraged although Sheung Wan MTR station is closer
